dialogues.text: He's so spaced out he wouldn't even notice. General laughter at Jeremy's expense. The TEACHER sighs.

dialogues.text: Anyone else ... JEREMY looks out the window to the blue sky. Then he stan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it off. No one would mess with him. He'll collect  all. the bombs. Zap!. They're history. The class erupts in ridicule and laughter. ANOTHER BOY (sarcastic) Why don't you call him up? You got his private

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: number, don't you?

dialogues.text: You're probably best friends. JEREMY looks around the room. The TEACHER wants to help h

dialogues.text: (with passion) You all think you're so cool, right? You'll be cool

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: even when the whole place gets vaporized ... Well,  I'm going to write Superman a letter and send it to  the Daily Planet.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER BOY

dialogues.speaker: JEREMY
dialogues.text: (as he write.)  'Dear Superman . . . '

dialogues.text: Okay, let's move on to our newest and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: most popular exhibit.

dialogues.text: The TOUR GROUP forms a semicircle around the statue. At t seems to be a FATHER and SON -- both wear dark glasses an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Made out of solid steel. Branded on it is its weight: lOO thin strand of what seems to be black wire, attached to a case.

dialogues.speaker: GUIDE
dialogues.text: (pointing it out) Superman has graciously donated a strand of  His hair to the museum. So we all could have  the fun of seeing how strong he really is. Here you can see a 1000-pound globe easily  suspended by his single hair. Oohs and aahs from the GROUP. GUIDE (Cont.) Now let's move on to our primate exhibit.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUP LEAVES
dialogues.text: But not the 'father' and 'son.' Once the pitter patter of 'father' takes off his hat and glasses. We see his bald p right up to the statue.

dialogues.speaker: LEX
dialogues.text: (addressing the statue)  Guess who! . . . Of course it's me! Your old buddy!  Lex Luthor . . . Hey, you don't look too bad yourself.  'Course I've put on a few pounds, but what the hey!  They feed you a lot of starch when you've in prison. (his Jokey tone becomes  more deadly) That was 'prison' . . . as in where you put me, Mr. Clean Say, we should get together soon. Over lunch, over  dinner, or ... over your dead body.

dialogues.text: He's standing by the glass case containing SUPERMAN'S hai out of his jacket. Throws off his baseball cap to REVEAL highlights.

dialogues.text: (to LENNY) Do you realize what I can create with a single

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: strand of Superman's hair!

dialogues.text: (thinking hard)  A toupee that flies?

dialogues.speaker: LEX
dialogues.text: (sighs) . . . I look at you, Lenny, and I know how the Romans  felt when the barbarians arrived at their city gate.

dialogues.speaker: LENNY
dialogues.text: But why the hair?

dialogues.speaker: LEX
dialogues.text: (gazes into the case) That hair contains a sample of Superman's genetic  material. The building blocks of his body. With  my genius and enough nuclear power to mutate  those genes, I will create a being with all his powers . but with absolute allegiance to me! LEX nods at  LENNY. LENNY raises the iron mallet above th SOUND all over the museum. As LEX reaches for the hair, L

dialogues.text: '. . . I don't care if everybody thinks I'm a space  cadet. Once you've destroyed all the nuclear  missiles in the world, they'll see I was right.  Superman can make sure we don't blow ourselves  up. Quick and easy. Thanks a lot. I know you'll  come through. Your friend, Jeremy.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: He's shaken to the core.  LOIS gets up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor kid. Oh well, back to work.

dialogues.text: An angle?

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: Daddy loves to whip up campaigns! People eat it  up. We'll make this kid a celebrity. The whole  world will be waiting for Superman's answer.

dialogues.text: CLARK has quietly gone to the door. He watches LACY pick LACY (Cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

The ex something in between confusion and fury. The coverall han LEX holds up a PHOTO OF SUPERMAN. LEX (Cont.) I created you for one reason only ... to destroy this

dialogues.text: The last traces of NUCLEAR MAN. Or at least what was once

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Superman broke your monster, Uncle Lex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must have miscalculated. How. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEX flops into a big leather chair. Rubs his eyes. LEX (cont.) Obviously normal radiation doesn't generate enough

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: mutant power in the cells. I need a greater source of  energy! If I could bake the genetic. material in the  core of the sun . . . (a moment of excitement, then he sits back) . . . Impossible. Even I have no way to reach the sun.

dialogues.speaker: THE ASH
dialogues.text: The still smoking evidence of LEX'S mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Uncle Lex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 157        EXT/ INT. WARFIELD'S LlMOUSINE  -  DAY  A stretched Mercedes.

dialogues.speaker: WARFIELD
dialogues.text: (pats her hand) Bringing the kid who wrote the letter to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Metropolis will be our greatest publicity  gimmick. And it was your idea! Perhaps it's time to discuss giving you free reign at one  of my papers . . . Miss Publisher! WARFIELD expects a big reaction. But LACY is staring out her mind. Mumbles aloud. LACY Who does Clark Kent think he is anyway! He

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: never even said good night!

dialogues.speaker: WARFIELD
dialogues.text: Clark Kent! You socialized with him . . . a . . .  reporter!

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: (snapping to: she's  said too much) Oh . . . no . . . I mean, we just went  dancing . . .   for  a story . . .

dialogues.speaker: WARFIELD
dialogues.text: (a lecture) Your grandfather had one iron rule that's stood me  well. Never fraternize with the help. Keep too your  own station. Am I clear? LACY nods, chastised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A private jet landing. On the side: Warfield Publications

dialogues.speaker: EXT . THE JET PARKED
dialogues.text: A crowd of REPORTERS has gathered. The door opens and JER Waiting below for him is WARFIELD. A bank of microphones WARFIELD ushers the scared BOY up to the crowd. He lets t few shots in, then steps to the mike.

dialogues.speaker: WARFIELD
dialogues.text: Go ahead son. Tell the American public what

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you told me.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMY
dialogues.text: (softly)  I just said . . . SNAP!  He's distracted by the PHOTOGRAPHERS. JEREMY (Cont.) . . . I just said I wished Superman would have

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: said 'yes' . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which spins like a pinwheel . . . blurring into . . .

dialogues.speaker: FRONT PAGE
dialogues.text: Screaming headline -- 'SUPERMAN TO KID: DROP DEAD.'

dialogues.speaker: LOIS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This time he's gone too far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JIMMY,  LOIS, and CLARK are staring at the latest edition PERRY I'm through taking it lying down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He storms out. Stops. Sticks his head back in. PERRY (Cont.) If anybody wants me .I'll be down town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he's gone.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JIMMY Did the Chief look different to you? LOIS He looked like my Dad did every time he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: went to the bank to try and borrow money. She notices CLARK staring intently at the headline. She c LOIS (Cont.) Clark, there's nothing any of us can do. It's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Superman's decision. I'm sure he knows what  he's doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK takes the paper and eyes fixed on the headline, wal CONTINUED ON NEXT PAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amendment. No: 6     (pink)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK is walking one way when WARFIELD and his cronies co escorting JEREMY. He seems bewildered by it all.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK AND JEREMY PASS EACH OTHER
dialogues.text: After a few steps, they both stop. JEREMY turns to look b smile. WARFIELD and his entourage pass on around the corn JEREMY approaches CLARK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (curiously) Do I know you?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (a beat, then) I'm Clark Kent, one of the staff reporters.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMY
dialogues.text: (whispers nervously)  Do you know Superman ? CLARK adjusts glasses, puts his hands in his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm acquainted with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK can see in JEREMY'S eyes a terrible confusion. CLAR Is there something you want, to tell him, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell him I didn't mean to cause him trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him not to listen to what all these papers  are saying. I just want him to do what he thinks  is right.  CLARK is moved. He puts an arm on JEREMY'S shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I'm sure Superman cares a lot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: more about what's in one boy's heart than all  the editorials. Amendment. No: 6     (pink)

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: He's made up his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soaring through the stormy heights of the upper atmospher

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blue-white world of frozen seas and perpetual dayligh seems to be glacial mountains, dazzling in reflected ligh

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN LANDS
dialogues.text: He stands for a moment at the base of icy peaks. His thou foot against the frozen tundra. The ground shakes and shi Thunderous echoes resound.

dialogues.speaker: THE SNOW-COVERED MOUNTAINS
dialogues.text: Respond to the pounding tremors. Snow begins to shake loo glimmering surfaces of THE FORTRESS OF SOLITUDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN stands in the centre of the great cavern. Smooth The green crystals containing the history of KRYPTON give about the ice palace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He touches and activates the crystals.

dialogues.speaker: 360 DEGREES
dialogues.text: All around him the walls came alive with the distorted so (footage from SUPERMAN I to be intercut)

dialogues.speaker: THE PLANET KRYPTON
dialogues.text: From outer space as the cataclysm overwhelms it. One smal apocalypse. The planet explodes. Disintegrating before ou

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN'S REACTION
dialogues.text: As the terrible fate of his natural home plays once more.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: Wondering if his decision now might have the same effect. voices soften until they are no more than a polyphony of SUPERMAN I know I have been forbidden to act, but now

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the Earth awaits a fate as terrible as Krypton's. A beat, and then . . . the great cavern erupts in thunder

dialogues.speaker: THE PLANET EARTH
dialogues.text: A celestial garden across the universe from KRYPTON. The once argued with JOR-EL now assault his son. ONE VOICE The earth is too primitive. You can flee to new

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: worlds where war is long forgotten.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND VOICE
dialogues.text: If you teach the world to put its fate in any one  man -- even yourself -- you are teaching them to  be betrayed . . . The word 'betrayed' echoes as the image disappears. The b world floods into the Fortress.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: You have taught me well . . . but sometimes there

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is more to learn from children than the wisest of  men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Eastside trendy bistro catering to the gold card crowd table. LOIS The notion that your father would stoop low

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: enough to attack Superman just to sell more  papers . . . LACY cuts her off. Her mind is elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I'm not exactly a Girl Scout but . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: maybe if I show him I'm trying . . . he'll  like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off balance) Who?

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: Clark. He's late again.  (frustrated) I can't figure him out.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: That's because there's nothing to figure out. Now

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: will you please pay attention. I'm not through  insulting your father.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: Lois, have you ever fallen for a guy and he's not  like other guys . . . he's different. It's like you come  from two different worlds. A major chord sounds in LOIS'S heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dreamy) And your heart beats faster just thinking about  him.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: Right . . . you want to tell him how you feel . . .

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: (wistful)  But he's never there.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: (sisters in arms) Why, Lois, I didn't know . . . Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOUND:  CRASH! A waiter drops a tray of glasses. The GIRL

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: (French accent) Look, up in the sky . . . It's . . . LOIS follows his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Superman. . .

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE THE TALL BUILDINGS
dialogues.text: Descending between the concrete canyons of Metropolis. Fl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traffic is stopping. Pedestrians suddenly forget their bu up towards . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floating overhead. He's looking for 'something or someone

dialogues.speaker: A HOT DOG WITH RELISH
dialogues.text: JEREMY is poised at a Sabrett stand, holding the wiener t JIMMY Got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) Mr. Warfield said he wanted pictures of you with  lots of local color, but I can't think of anything else  really special.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE CAMERA
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN steps into the frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)  What a scoop! SUPERMAN puts his arm around JEREMY. JIMMY snaps the pict

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: Would you mind taking a walk with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely!

dialogues.speaker: SCRIPT CONTINUES ON NEXT PAGE
dialogues.text: AMENDMENT  NO. 11      (pink)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stride forward along the busy Metropolis street. In astonished glances. JIMMY runs along, taking pictures. A follow SUPERMAN. He never varies his pace. Eyes forward. Horns blare in recognition. The crowd swells behind him.

dialogues.speaker: A HUNDRED FLAGPOLES
dialogues.text: The flags of the nations. Every colour and every pattern row along the river. SUPERMAN quickens his step. JEREMY k spills over into the street. POLICE are rushing in to con Volkswagen car forces its way through. LOIS is driving.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS AND LACY
dialogues.text: Jump out of the car. Start to push their way through the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN continues his march across the gleaming marble f PATROLMEN, one CHINESE, one SWEDISH, stand guard at the d They turn to see SUPERMAN leading a small army of citizen

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: (to his partner) I don't think he has a pass.

dialogues.speaker: SWEDISH PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: I don't think he needs one.

dialogues.speaker: THE PATROLMEN OPEN THE DOORS TO THE ASSEMBLY.
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN turns to JEREMY. SUPERMAN Would you mind waiting for me in the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: visitor's gallery?

dialogues.speaker: JEREMY
dialogues.text: (still overwhelmed)  N-no...I mean...you bet. SUPERMAN steps past the PATROLMEN and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the podium, the Speaker abruptly stops his harangue. T Pakistani woman, wearing a Sari, stands up. Around one by Some drop their translator earplugs.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE CENTER AISLE
dialogues.text: Walking slowly, humbly down the sloped steps. The hall fa delegates rise from their seats.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE PODIUM
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN looks up at the SECRETARY GENERAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame Secretary, I represent no country. May I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: address the delegates?

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY GENERAL
dialogues.text: (fights to stay calm) Yes, well... you need a sponsor. SUPERMAN turns to the delegates. A beat, then all their h

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY GENERAL
dialogues.text: (smiles) I believe that will do. Please. She holds out her hand to the mike. SUPERMAN walks to the

dialogues.speaker: UP IN THE GALLERY
dialogues.text: REPORTERS are scrambling for the available seats.  JEREMY his arm. LOIS Come with me. JEREMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is intense!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She pulls him up front where LACY and JIMMY OLSEN have wr balcony. LOIS gazes down at the extraordinary spectacle. LACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)  What's he going to say?

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: (mesmerized)  Something . . . wonderful. 192        FROM THE PODIUM  -  SUPERMAN'S P.O.V. He waits for the DELEGATES to settle into their seats. Be nation on Earth. He steps forward and speaks. SUPERMAN For many years I've lived among you as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a visitor. I've seen beauty in your many  cultures and I've felt joy in your many  accomplishments. . . I've also seen the  folly of your wars . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEN in dashikis and women in chadors, visitors with young SUPERMAN . . . As of today, I am no longer a visitor. (a beat, his voice grows stronger) The Earth is my home too. We cannot live in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fear. I cannot watch you stumble into the madness  of nuclear destruction. So I have come to a decision . .

dialogues.speaker: ON THE VISITOR'S GALLERY
dialogues.text: JEREMY leans forward.  LOIS and JIMMY clasp hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am going to do what your governments have been

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: unable to do. . . I will rid our planet of all nuclear  weapons.

dialogues.speaker: THE GENERAL ASSEMBLEY
dialogues.text: A second of lag time as the translations are made. Then t wild cheering.

dialogues.speaker: VISITORS BALCONY
dialogues.text: The civilians applaud, many in tears. LOIS puts her finge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rebel yell) All-right !

dialogues.text: Great schools of fish ride the cold currents of the plane 198        A NUCLEAR SUBMARINE - U.S. S. MELVILLE: Stock

dialogues.text: Cruises silently into view. Another hunter of the deep. 199        EXT. THE SURFACE OF THE OCEAN  -  DAY: Stock S Small whitecaps decorate the endless blue-green sea. Balm 200        A WHITE BUBBLE:  Stock Shot Of turbulent water suddenly forms, sending sharp waves of 201        BREAKING THE SURFACE:  Stock Shot Seawater steaming from its hot exhaust, a missile rises i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reacts to the missile and turns toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grey-haired COMMANDER stands over a SAILOR checking the 204        EXT. PENTAGON -  DAY -  ESTABLISHING: Stock sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The secret command center. A large group of senior office congressmen watching . . .

dialogues.speaker: AN ELECTRONIC SCREEN
dialogues.text: One half blue, the other red. Superimposed are rows of sm

dialogues.speaker: THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: Two blips converge - one representing SUPERMAN, the other in the room turn to watch. Amendment No. 2       (pink)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN catches the rocket, extinguishes the engine, and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still watching the radar screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got it, sir. Congratulations!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SAILOR shakes hands with the COMMANDER while the CREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A silver-haired SENATOR turns to the uniformed  CHIEF OF SENATOR So far, so good. (shakes his head) It will take even Superman a long time to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: dispose of these arsenals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just make sure he doesn't leave one side with  few souvenirs.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR
dialogues.text: (snaps)  I trust Superman.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF OF STAFF
dialogues.text: So do I. But . . . he's the only person I do trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Soviet missile launcher flanked by CREW on foot and wit into view and comes to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: MISSILE LAUNCHER MEMBERS VEHICLE
dialogues.text: The CREW prepares for the launch.

dialogues.speaker: RISING FROM THE LAUNCHER
dialogues.text: A nuclear MISSILE. It trembles, almost like slow motion. Amendment No. 2       (pink)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fiery burst and then the dreaded contrail arcs across t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again the two blips converge.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN rides the deadly Soviet missile, guiding it out of his long peace mission.

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING DOWN FROM THE STRATOSPHERE
dialogues.text: We can see the outline of Russia on the curve of the Eart larger rapidly until we identify SUPERMAN and his heavy l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN guides the missile into a vast net constructed o in space and filled to capacity with the world's nuclear the others and closes the net.

dialogues.speaker: FRAME
dialogues.text: The yellow star in the sky source of life on Earth, is ac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a great effort SUPERMAN whirls the huge net around a net grows smaller and smaller on its path to the sun. We vibrant orange explosion tells us it has been destroyed. and then turns for home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A God's eye view of the city. Just the way LEX likes it.

dialogues.speaker: THREE MEN
dialogues.text: Stand around a table, eyeing each other with suspicion an Amendment No. 2       (pink)

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR OPENS
dialogues.text: All three MEN pull out small revolvers and point them at

dialogues.speaker: LEX LUTHOR
dialogues.text: Hands go up, a smile of seduction comes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to see you too, gentleman. If we can just

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: relax, I'll get started with the introductions. The three reluctantly put away their guns and take seats. MEN eye LEX warily as he strolls around the table and res HOWLER, a fidgety porcine intellectual. LEX (Cont.) From the land of the free and the home of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cost overrun, let's welcome Harry Howler,  nuclear strategist for America's top think tank  and a great warmonger in his own right . . . LEX now moves around to DUBOIS, an impeccably dressed, si LEX (Cont.) . . . and next, a hearty bienvenu to Jean-Pierre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DuBois, nuclear warhead dealer to the world.  His motto ... " if you didn't buy it from Jean Pierre,  you didn't buy it on the black market" . . . Third is ROMOFF, a bushy-eyebrowed Soviet General in full LEX (Cont.) . . . Our third guest has a bad rap for always trying to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: drag his country into war. Some people like to call  General Romoff the Mad Russian, but to me he's  just . . . eccentric. SOUND:  BAM! A loud retort off screen and ROMOFF jumps up from his pocket. The others dive under the table, drawing

dialogues.speaker: ROMOFF
dialogues.text: If this is a CIA trap, you'll never take me alive!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEX looks to the door and frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points) My nephew LENNY is learning the drums. (he goes to ROMOFF  and takes his gun) Guns don't kill people -- people kill people. Look,  I know you're all a little choked up right now (saunters by each man) . . . overcome by the joy of knowing that Superman  is ending the arms race . . . Think of it, Dubois,  you can finally retire. You can go into something  nice like home appliances. There's a real mark-up  in dishwashers . . . The guests have slouched low in their chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get to the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEX opens his arms. His smile can only be called Devilish

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The points is that I, Lex Luthor, the greatest criminal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: mind of the modern era, have discovered a way to destroy Superman! SOUND: BAM!   On LEX'S last word, the room is drowned wit world's worst drum solo LEX (Cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keeping his smile)  Oh, Lenny. . . ? (louder) Lenny! (sighs) Any of you guys have teenagers at home? (screams ferociously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drumming stops. Sounds of running. LENNY skids into t of drumsticks. LEX holds out his hand. LENNY is a forlorn over the sticks. LEX breaks them in half. LENNY Gee, Uncle Lex, I was just getting to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: good part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the box, nephew. LENNY runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (icy) I warn you, Luthor, if you've dragged us here just

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to tell us you possess a piece of kryptonite . . .

dialogues.speaker: ROMOFF
dialogues.text: We've all tried to use kryptonite before. LEX throws up his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't the word 'genius' mean anything these

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: days? (he opens the curtains)  Behold, my unscrupulous friends . . .

dialogues.speaker: OUT THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: A spectacular view of Metropolis is barely visible for th sky.

dialogues.speaker: HOWLER
dialogues.text: Close the curtains. The sun is hurting my eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LEX
dialogues.text: Of course it is. Do you know what the sun is? Why it's  just one huge nuclear bomb. A bomb with enough  radiation to incinerate an average man like . . . (he snaps his finger) that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Superman isn't an average man.

dialogues.speaker: LEX
dialogues.text: (acts offended)  And what am I? A Shriner? No, If you'll join  forces with me, together we can make the world  safe for war profits again.

dialogues.speaker: ROMOFF
dialogues.text: (biting the hook)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your plan? LENNY runs back in carrying a glass case in rests the pet

dialogues.speaker: LEX
dialogues.text: Boys, old Lex has a secret recipe in this dish . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: call it a genetic stew. You help me place it on one  of your missiles and I promise you . . . if Superman  throws it into the sun, he'll get the biggest surprise  of his life. I'll be able to introduce Superman to his  first nightmare . . . a Nuclear Man!

dialogues.speaker: HOWLER
dialogues.text: And this so-called . . . Nuclear Man. . . of yours can  defeat Superman?

dialogues.speaker: LEX
dialogues.text: Do people die in Italian Operas? Gentlemen, if all goes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to plan Nuclear Man will return from the sun with  power awesome enough to do what none before him  has ever been able to . . . pierce Superman's skin. He'll be mortal, he'll get sick . . . and we'll dance on his gr

dialogues.speaker: DUBOIS
dialogues.text: (apprehensive) Why should we make a deal with a notorious scoundrel  like you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMENDMENT NO.3         (pink)

dialogues.speaker: LEX
dialogues.text: Don't!...Then the world will have eternal peace and  you boys will have to find day jobs. Just remember,  the more fear we make, the more loot you take. As  long as the world hangs on the brink of war, the good  life is available to every criminal . . . regardless of r religion or natural origin! LEX has delivered his holy creed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what do we get out of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (goes to the window)         If my plan works, gentlemen, I'll just take a tiny

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: commission . . . something . . .appropriate. . . a  number with a lot of zeros after it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting down onto: The doorway of a gigantic hangar. A F

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: conference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK and LACY are in the back. Her luggage is piled arou door, but he doesn't move. LACY Daddy's offered me jobs at some of his other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: companies. But, I've been thinking maybe I'll  take some time off. (a wry smile) I'm going to find a place like Smallville, in the country. Maybe a  farm . . .  see what the slow  lane is like.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to see you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to be polite, Clark. I've got a pretty

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: good idea of how you feel about me.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: I'm not so sure you do.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: Any more like you back home, Clark?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Like me?

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: You know: strong, gentle, tall men with bright blue  eyes and square. Men who like to dance slow, the old fashioned way, the way their mothers taught them on  the night before their prom.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LACY leans over and wraps her arms around CLARK. She hold CLARK steps outside and closes the door. She leans out th CLARK You'll find a good man Lacy. You deserve one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if you'd have met who I am now, instead of the  spoiled brat you met a few weeks ago, it would have  been different between us.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Lacy. . . I . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts her finger to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: No. Don't answer. I want to consider the possibilities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK laughs with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you get to Smallville, I know a real estate agent . . . . . Levon Hornsby. He may have the perfect place

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: available. Tell him you know me. She reaches up and touches his face. The taxi pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: (leaning out) Say goodbye to Superman for me.

dialogues.speaker: THE U.N. PLAZA
dialogues.text: A multitude has assembled. CLARK starts working his way t

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT OF THE CROWD
dialogues.text: CLARK pushes his way up front. JIMMY notices him first. H LOIS starts when she sees CLARK, then regains her composu into an impish grin. JIMMY Hi Mr. Kent. How do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: It's a beautiful day, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: As she moves closer to CLARK. Her eyes sparkle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mischievously) It must have been a super effort to get out of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bed, Clark.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Well, I'm feeling a lot better . . . almost chipper . . . (slightest smile) . . . and all because I had a visit from a very  good nurse.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: She must have had some strong medicine. Lois said

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you were really ill.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (looking at LOIS) Well Jimmy, sometimes a little loving care is the  best medicine.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: (softly) I'm glad you're here. (a beat, then the  old LOIS) And don't forget I'm covering Superman's press conference You just tape reactions from people in the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CLARK pats his pockets. CLARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, I left my new tape recorder in the taxi!  Somebody save my place. CLARK runs back through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same old Mr. Kent . . . he'll never change.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: (smiles) I hope not.

dialogues.speaker: THE FLAGS OF ALL NATIONS
dialogues.text: The wind begins to pick up. And the crowd starts to buzz.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: He's here!

dialogues.speaker: ON TOP OF U.N. BUILDING
dialogues.text: He waves at the CROWD and then flies down to land in fron

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to see you again, Lois.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to see you.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN STEPS TO THE MICROPHONE
dialogues.text: The CROWD falls silent. SUPERMAN Once more we have survived the threat of war. And

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: once more we've found a fragile peace. I thought I  could give you all the gift of freedom from war.  But I was wrong. It is not mine to give. AMENDMENT NO. 10   (pink)

dialogues.speaker: FLASH CUT TO CHINESE COUNTRYSIDE
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON old fashioned LOUDSPEAKER on rickety pole. PULL BACK to reveal FOUR CHINESE PEASANTS, one a YOUNG MO BABY strapped to her back, working in the fields in the s

dialogues.speaker: CHINA."
dialogues.text: They listen to the broadcast.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH CUT TO LENIN'S TOMB
dialogues.text: A RUSSIAN WEDDING PARTY of eight persons and TWO RED GUAR enter the mausoleum with the broadcast sounding over the

dialogues.speaker: FLASH CUT TO A SCHOOLYARD
dialogues.text: JEREMY'S CLASSMATES are listening on a GHETTO BLASTER. JE behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . . . Our Planet is still young. There are galaxies

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: around us with other civilizations to meet and  learn from. A community of planets for us to join.  What a brilliant future we can have. But there will  only be peace when the people want it so badly,  their governments will have no choice but to give  it to them. (his voice grows bolder) I wish you could all see the earth as I see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It dawns on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . . . Maybe you can! If you'll all excuse me for one minu One step and he bounds into the air!

dialogues.speaker: ON LOIS
dialogues.text: Like everyone else, confused as SUPERMAN soars away. AMENDMENT NO. 10   (pink)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loud WHOOSH makes the KIDS Look to the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your help, Jeremy.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN HOLDS OUT HIS HAND TO JEREMY
dialogues.text: JEREMY takes it.

dialogues.speaker: UP, UP AND AWAY
dialogues.text: The SCHOOLKIDS gasp as SUPERMAN carries JEREMY into the s

dialogues.speaker: THE PLANET EARTH
dialogues.text: Shining brightly in green and blue and white wisps of clo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Soyuz Space Capsule, from the opening scenes, continu watching through the porthole. SUPERMAN and JEREMY fly pa

dialogues.speaker: INTO FRAME
dialogues.text: JEREMY watches from a super vantage point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awesome!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy, I need you to tell the people of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: world what you see.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMY
dialogues.text: I'll try. . . AMENDMENT NO. 10   (pink)

dialogues.speaker: THE EARTH
dialogues.text: As they pass over the continents.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMY
dialogues.text: Well . . . I see the ocean currents. . . and the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: rain . . . and mountains and rivers. . . but . . .

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: Go on . . .

dialogues.speaker: JEREMY
dialogues.text: But you can't tell where one country begins and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: another ends. You can't see any borders. It's  just . . . one world.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: Good. If you can see it, and I can see it, maybe some  day everyone will see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He arcs toward the CAMERA. Coming right at us.

dialogues.speaker: FLYING AT THE CAMERA
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN and JEREMY.  MOVE CLOSER ON SUPERMAN as he gives salute and then carries JEREMY home.
